text: Thanks AJ Laporte. That was helpful. I have another requirement, where  we need to add custom filters. Currently we have just tag and date filter. What if i want to add custom filters apart from tag and date. Like i want my blog to be categorised in different categories which are not tags. And then filter them based on category. Can i do that?

Hi All,

I have a another requirement, where  we need to add custom filters. Currently we have just tag and date filter. What if i want to add custom filters apart from tag and date. Like i want my blog to be categorised in different categories which are not tags. And then filter them based on category. How can i do that? I can't find any relevant tutorial for the same

Hi Samriti, you should be able to accomplish this as well, though it would require you to create a custom module so you can house those different options and then you would want to use some advanced HubL in order to get those options and return the results. See these resources here for more info:
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/create-and-edit-modules>

<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/how-to-use-developer-info-on-cms-pages>
Thank you. I'll look into them.
xposting this from the thread above: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CCQ7H31D5/p1571065455019000?thread_ts=1570781645.015400&cid=CCQ7H31D5>

Please see this article here: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/hubl/syntax>
I would also recommend going through our academy and doing the CMS for developers certification. This can help to give you a better understanding of the HubSpot Platform: <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers?library=true>

its HubSpot Markup Language. This is based on the Jinja template language.
How can i assign those custom moldule options to blog?
Means I need to filter blog on the basis of this category.
Form 2 is not a HubSpot form. I will look into this. Thank you.

Thank you. Since my last post, I did integrate UIKit 3 and it has been playing very nicely-so long as I use wrappers in the drag/drop interface. My clients want to copy/paste and quickly modify layouts without code so I need to stay within the drag/drop realm.  Using a prefix on the classes has been key-thanks!
